intro: Corydalis senanensis, commonly known as the Senan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, creeping stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Corydalis genus.
